title: Commending Neil's Wheels upon the occasion of its designation for special recognition for its ongoing efforts to raise the awareness of and alleviate hunger and homelessness
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION commending Neil's Wheels upon the occasion of its
designation  for  special  recognition  for ongoing efforts to raise the
awareness of and alleviate hunger and homelessness on Long Island

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that  the
quality  and  character of life in the communities across New York State
are reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those organiza-
tions and individuals that are devoted to the welfare of  the  community
and its citizenry; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
Neil's  Wheels upon the occasion of its designation for special recogni-
tion for ongoing efforts to raise the awareness of and alleviate  hunger
and homelessness on Long Island; and
  WHEREAS,  Neil's  Wheels was established in 1999 to help students feel
comfortable and safe when discussing any problem, including  alcoholism,
drug addiction and mental illness; and
  WHEREAS,  Named after former Manhasset High School star lacrosse play-
er, Neil Barber, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia  in  1995,  Neil's
Wheels has been extraordinarily active in the community; based on Neil's
own  battle  with mental illness and subsequent homelessness, the organ-
ization focuses on feeding the homeless on Long Island; and
  WHEREAS, Among its myriad activities, Neil's  Wheels  has  promoted  a
successful  Manhasset  Middle  School  dance which collected 821 cans of
food for homeless dinners and ecumenical food pantries on  Long  Island;
and
  WHEREAS,  In addition, Neil's Wheels has achieved success in its spon-
sorship of events to raise food for  the  homeless  and  hungry  at  St.
Peter's School Halloween dances in Port Washington, New York, as well as
with  student  community  projects  and  Boy  and  Girl  Scout  outreach
programs; and
  WHEREAS, The New York Islanders professional hockey  team  has  desig-
nated Neil's Wheels as the beneficiary for donations of food at its game
to  be  held  on March 26, 2011, at the Nassau Coliseum; each fan at the
game is encouraged to bring one can of food as the admittance fee; it is
estimated that 18,000 cans of food for the homeless will be donated as a
result of this initiative; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to call attention to
organizations of such noble aims and accomplishments as  Neil's  Wheels,
which  serve to bring people together for the united purpose of actively
pursuing improvements in their communities; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Neil's  Wheels upon the occasion of its designation for special
recognition for ongoing efforts to raise the awareness of and  alleviate
homelessness and hunger on Long Island; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Neil's Wheels.
